preferences.title: Preferences
preferences.traceMinMeters: Minimum distance between each recorded point
preferences.traceMinMeters_explaination:
A value that is too low may result in a low-quality track due to the imprecision of GPS.
A value that is too high may also produce a low-quality track with long straight lines.
It is also important to consider that the shorter the distance, the higher the number of recorded points, which can impact battery consumption during recording.
For a good compromise, we recommend a value of 15 meters (approximately 0.01 miles).
preferences.traceMinMillis: Minimum time between each recorded point
preferences.traceMinMillis_explaination:
If you want to limit the number of recorded points to reduce battery consumption, you can use a longer minimum time between each recorded point. The minimum distance between each point is also taken into account, so BOTH the minimum distance and minimum time must be reached before recording a new point.
We recommend setting the minimum time to 0 and only applying a distance limitation.
preferences.offlineMapMaxKeepDays: Number of days a downloaded map is valid
preferences.offlineMapMaxKeepDays_explaination: When you download a map to make it available offline, this setting indicates how long it will be retained. This also makes it possible to not download a map item if it has already been downloaded recently, saving time when downloading.
preferences.thunderforest_explaination: You can add maps from thunderforest.com if you have an account on their web site (a free account is available). Enter your API key below

delete_confirm.title: Delete Collection
delete_confirm.message: Are you sure you want to delete collection {{}}?

offline_map.max_zoom_explaination: The higher you select a zoom level, the more you will be able to zoom during your trail when you are offline, but consequently the longer the download will take and the more storage space will be required on your device.
offline_map.max_zoom_reco: A value between 15 and 17 is recommended. Below 15, the level of detail is often too low to see small paths clearly. Above 17, the download size is large, and is generally not necessary to perfectly follow a route.
offline_map.padding_explaination: Percentage of the area to download in around the trail area (100% means only the trail area). Allows you to see more around the trail in offline mode.

disabled_popup.title: GPS disabled
disabled_popup.message: Your GPS is disabled, please enable it to start a track.
